title: Billie Eilish has ring stolen by fan from her finger during set
text:
Poor Billie! (Picture: Getty Images North America)

Billie Eilish has had her ring stolen by a fan, from her finger, during a concert.

That’s right – the thing was taken off the singer’s finger during a recent gig. Fans sure are ruthless these days.

The 17-year-old singer was performing at the Austin City Limits Music Festival when she noticed the piece of jewellery was taken after returning to the stage from an interaction in the crowd.

Instead of rushing off stage or throwing a hissy fit over the ring, she merely encouraged the new owner to ‘take care’ of it.

She really is a legend. Duh!

She was in good spirits about it (Picture: WireImage)

After returning to the stage, the visibly annoyed star exclaimed: ‘Somebody stole my f***ing ring! I guess that’s my fault.’

However, it seemed the star didn’t want to let the theft ruin her mood.

She added: ‘Keep that s**t. Take care of that s**t. You okay though? Are you okay? Are you crushed? No? Okay, I am…’

“Somebody stole my fucking ring”

“Guess that’s my fault”

“Keeeep that shit”

“Take Care of that shit”

This is our Queen @billieeilish pic.twitter.com/ND1jBPokVh — Tbird 🦋 (@Tbird_th98) October 13, 2019

It was at this stage a number of fans in the crowd then began chanting for the return of the ring, calling: ‘Give it back.’

However, Billie urged them not to ‘worry’ about what had happened as she wasn’t expecting to get it back.

Which makes us think it wasn’t worth all that much. Still, that’s beside the point, right?

She said: ‘The ring is gone for good. It’s OK, don’t worry about it. Whoever has that shit, though, take care of it, OK?’

Meanwhile, the Lovely singer recently admitted she is grateful she didn’t get time to be a ‘normal teenager’ before her career took off as it means there is no ‘dirt’ on her that can be exposed.

Kind of a grim thought to have, but we can hardly blame her in this era of such rabid cancel culture.

She said: ‘There’s a part of me that feels like… I didn’t get to be a teenager, like, a normal one.

‘More and more I get more grateful for it happening that young because I feel like, if it happened later, that people would be able to dig up dirt from when I was that age.

‘If this hadn’t happened at that age, I would’ve been doing some reckless s**t.’

Silver linings, and all that.
